info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 3:57PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. John The Baptist, southeastern St. Helena, west central St. Tammany, Livingston and Tangipahoa Parishes through 445 PM CDT... At 357 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Independence, or 8 miles southwest of Amite, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Denham Springs, Covington, Greensburg, Amite, Ponchatoula, Walker, Amite City, Livingston, Independence, Roseland, French Settlement, Albany, Madisonville, Springfield, Montpelier, Natalbany, Robert, Killian and Tickfaw. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 13 and 65. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 11 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
